pageContext.claim: “In the years since the [JCPOA] deal was reached, Iran's military budget has grown by almost 40 percent, while its economy is doing very badly.”
pageContext.analysis: Iran's military expenditure grew nearly 30 percent from 2015, when the JCPOA was adopted, to 2017, according to the Stockholm International Peace Research Institute. The value of Iran's currency is sliding, and GDP growth has fallen since the first year of the JCPOA, but GDP still was expected to grow at a healthy rate of 4 percent in 2018, according to the BBC.
